intro: Wulfenia baldaccii, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and has adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. Wulfenia baldaccii is often found in crevices and along canyon walls, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
